intro: Crassocephalum latifolium, commonly known as the broadleaf sandmat, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa and Asia. It is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves and produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in arid or semi-arid environments. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is known for its medicinal properties in traditional medicine. The species is also used as a forage plant for livestock in some regions.
